comments:
Courtney Shah game 1.

First game with Dr. Sanjay Gupta as guest host.

Champion's winnings & consolation amounts matched to Odyssey Atlanta.

clues.clue: Steven Tyler of this group said the Grateful Dead "were worried about us, so that gives you some idea of how (messed) up & crazy we were"
In 2019 Pete Townshend & Roger Daltrey released this band's first album in 13 years
The classic "Free Bird" by this southern rock group was a tribute to Duane Allman
At the 2019 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony, this group played "Boys Don't Cry"
Fans of this current band are known as Firebreathers
In an April 19, 1951 speech, he gave new life to the well-worn phrase "Old soldiers never die; they just fade away"
The first deaf & blind person to earn a bachelor of arts, this woman noted, "Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement"
This Secretary of Defense during the Iraq War offered, "There are also unknown unknowns, the ones we don't know we don't know"
This American Red Cross founder said she'd sometimes teach for free but if paid, "Never do a man's work for less than a man's pay"
Attributed to this leader of the Soviet Union in the 1970s: "The trouble with free elections is, you never know who is going to win"
Gene Roddenberry was familiar with this word meaning "a journey" from the Afrikaans
"Hero" this type of searching journey in folklore is the name of a Milton Bradley fantasy game
Norway has revived a 400-mile one of these religious journeys that was not taken much since the Protestant Reformation
An epic poem that begins by talking about a hero's travels gave us this word for a journey
Many striking photos were brought back by the 1901-1904 British National Antarctic this Venture
Residents of this South Dakota capital pronounce it to rhyme with "ear"
Makes sense that this is by far the most populous county in Wisconsin
When this Connecticut city was really "new" in 1683, it was called Quinnipiac
The Guadalupe, Trinity & Sabine Rivers all flow through this state
Bald Mountain is a popular skiing area in this Idaho valley
In 1997 Toyota introduced this model, the world's first mass-produced hybrid-powered vehicle
This interior panel evolved from a piece of wood attached to a carriage that prevented mud from splattering the driver
For the 2016 James Bond movie "Spectre", this British automaker built a new model, the DB10, especially for the film
The adventures of this Ford model named for Ford's estate lasted from 1955 through 1970 when the name was dropped in the U.S.
A status symbol of the time, some say this company's Bearcat put the "roar" in the Roaring Twenties
The garden object known as the shishi-odoshi translates as scarer of these skittish ruminants who are thought to flee at the noise
I heard you coming up the garden walkway due to the crunchy stones called "pea" this I used to line the path
Less noisy than today's models, here's an antique pair of these implements that help keep my garden in top shape
I use wind chimes in my garden as part of this 2-word Chinese art that aspires to harmonious balance
The flower seen here is the angel's this, & while it doesn't make a sound like a brass instrument, it rustles nicely in the breeze
3 astronauts are marooned in the future in the Nebula Award-winning 1976 novella this city, this city, "Do You Read?"
This Englishwoman's novella "The Lifted Veil" had a prophetic title, as it was soon revealed that George was a pseudonym
Thomas Mann wrote a 1903 novella about an unheroic guy ironically titled this name of Isolde's lover
Melville House Press offers classic novellas in book form, & of course included the tale of this title sailor by Melville himself
In English, "Cronica de Una Muerte Anunciada" by Gabriel García Márquez is titled "Chronicle of" this
At a 657 battle during the First Fitna, or Civil War, fighting stopped after soldiers put pages of this on their lances
A dispute over the rightful successor to Muhammad splintered Islam into these 2 main rival branches
A caliphate established in Baghdad in the 8th century endured until the 1258 sack of the city by these Asian invaders
After winning the 1187 Battle of Hattin, this sultan personally beheaded a crusader who had broken a Muslim-Christian truce
The Arabic word for this Mystic form of Islam is Tasawwuf, "to dress in wool", as early adherents are thought to have done
Fog & mist are considered types of this, though they don't come out of a can
Tree sloths are tinged green not with envy but with a type of this that grows in their fur
Before some of them fuse together, your spine consists of 33 of these bones
Originating in Valencia, Spain, it's the tasty dish seen here
They're those tiny little bumps on the surface of your tongue

double_jeopardy.category: JAMES BEARD CHEF OF THE YEAR

clues.category: JAMES BEARD CHEF OF THE YEAR

clues.clue: In addition to winning in 1997 for the French Laundry, Thomas Keller created the look of the title dish of this 2007 Pixar film

clues.category: JAMES BEARD CHEF OF THE YEAR
clues.clue: Born in Spain, he was the 2011 James Beard Chef of the Year & the 2018 James Beard Humanitarian of the Year

clues.category: JAMES BEARD CHEF OF THE YEAR
clues.clue: Alice Waters, the first woman to win the award, won for Chez Panisse in this California college town

clues.category: JAMES BEARD CHEF OF THE YEAR
clues.clue: 2010 was good for this man, he won a James Beard award for Craft, his restaurant, & an Emmy, for "Top Chef" on Bravo
In photosynthesis, green plants use sunlight & carbon dioxide to produce this simple sugar as an energy source
This "ancient life" geologic era ended about 250 million years ago as most species on Earth died out
Discovered in 1956, this subatomic particle with no charge & very little mass is part of a family of particles called leptons
Used to make nuclear fuel, impure uranium oxide is known by this "colorful" name
This physicist's effect is the change in a wave's frequency based on this relative motion between observer & source
Just imagine the crossover episode of "Elementary" & "Friends", as both took place primarily on this island
The Arrow, Swan & Pearl stations were all created by the Dharma Initiative for the island on this show
This show was rebooted in 1998 with Malcolm McDowell as Mr. Roarke; Michael Pena played the role in the 2020 film
A 1981 made-for-TV movie saw this basketball team pitted against robots, with the fate of "Gilligan's Island" on the line
Sissy Spacek & Sam Shepard ran an inn in the Florida Keys on this "sanguine" Netflix show

final_jeopardy.clue: The future Charles I suddenly became next in line to the throne of Austria in this year
